intro: Dalzellia ceylanica, commonly known as the Ceylon dalzellia, is a flowering plant native to Sri Lanka. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, smooth fruits. Dalzellia ceylanica is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
